constant.help: This node provices a constant value which is transmitted once on each reload.

round-robin-shift.paletteHelp: Sends true round robin on one output after the other incrementing or decrementing the output index on every input.
round-robin-shift.help:
Sends true round robin on one output after the other. TGF ("trigger forward") increments the output index. TGB ("trigger backward") decrements the output index.

RES resets the output index so the next input triggers the specified output.
round-robin-shift.input1Description: Every input triggers an output of true on the currently selected output and increments the output index by one.
round-robin-shift.input2Description: Every input triggers an output of true on the currently selected output and decrements the output index by one.
round-robin-shift.input3Description: Resets the output index to the specified value so the next input triggers the specified output.

toggle.tip: Tip: See help tab for usage information.
toggle.help: Use this node to toggle a variable in Homegear. It outputs the new value. When no variable is specified, the node just outputs the toggled value. When a variable is specified, Node-BLUE tries to get the current value and inverts it's state. Use feedback input enables a second input which can be used to update the current variable value. When enabled, the current value of the variable is ignored and only this feedback value is inverted and written to the specified variable.
toggle.input1Description: Every input toggles the specified variable.
toggle.output1Description: Outputs the new value of the variable.

variable-loop-prevention-group.help: To inhibit feedback loops (variable 1 sets variable 2 which causes variable 2 to set variable 1) you can enable the feedback loop prevention. Add all variables causing the loop to the same loop prevention group and set a group refractory period long enough to catch all feedback events.

variable-out.tip: Tip: See help tab for usage information.
variable-out.help: Use this node to set a variable in Homegear. When the variable was successfully set, the node outputs true. On error it outputs false. Please beware that not all errors are handled and this doesn't work for all device families. So make sure, you test all relevant error conditions.
variable-out.input1Description: The value to set the referenced variable to.
variable-out.output1Description: Outputs true on success and false on error.
